column4: Is there any way to keep the panels even using for example Firefox in fullscreen mode? I want to be able to run applications in fullscreen but still be able to see my panals. Is this possible?
you could use tinymenu and a slim firefox theme like liquifox to get more screen realestate for browsing
you can pretty much get all the useful stuff on a single line

I use Vimperator and that gives me a pretty clean and usefull interference, but It would be great to use Fx in fullscreen without hiding the panels at the same time, almost like maximizing but not exactly.
you can use tis sort of thing maybe to define the window size, not sure if its useful or not: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=482203
I'll chek it out. Otherwise Unity Panel may be a solution. Is it working or are there many bugs?
I doubt that the posts in the forums is a solution of my problem.
submit a suggestion is all I can (funnily) suggest
Mhm, this may not be a problem at all in gnome-shell, I don't know.
if wine is giving you jip i'd ask in #winehq
Not only Wine, the same problem occur playing games in Ubuntu and changing the resolution to like 640x480. The new desktop show up as a box in the old ones, having black area around it.
Thanks for the tip, but I want to learn to use the Terminal as UI as much as possible. I'm just wondering how I input environmental variables to a script using crontab -e to set the cron job.
lets you define the res of the server screen :)
I don't use ATI or nVidia cards. I'm running Ubuntu Server in vbox using my netbook as host. :)
